data.title: Good spread for an expensive picnic
data.text: It's good food.  Pretty straight-forward western BBQ.  Big menu, cute cafe, ordinary table service.  It's just too damn expensive.

data.title: Yummy!!
data.text: This place is super yummy. I enjoy the smoked chicken croissant sandwich (not sure with actual name is) & the sweet tea. My husband loves the kitchen sink salad (vegetarian). Parking is always easy & the service is great.  The ambience is nice. This is a great place to bring family or friends for a bite to eat.

data.title: Not so good
data.text: My husband and I reside fairly close to this establishment. We figured it was time to at least try the food. I called in an order. This should have been the first sign of things to come because I was put on hold for three minutes. We ordered 2 rib plates with a chicken breast and a link on the side. The ribs did not have any bark (the true BBQ fans out there you know what I am referring to), the bark contains most of the flavor, the smoke ring was non-existant. The ribs lacked flavor. The chicken was very dry and sliced extremely thin. The sides were not appealing at all; the green beans were very soft and the beans and rice were bland, maybe even as bland as the ribs. However, the cornbread was soft and sweet, with nice crunch along the edges. The links we ordered on the side, I can not comment on because we did not eat them.

data.title: Good food
data.text:
Visited with family for a good meal. We had spare ribs and pulled pork. Everything was very good and came super quick. Large portions. 
Potato salad and coleslaw were good, pasta salad less.
Iced tea is recommended. 
Corn bread yummy 
Reasonable price.

data.title: Nothing too special...
data.text:
I went with co-workers for a quick dinner after flying into town. I had a half plate of the chicken, it was more of a roasted chicken than anything I would call barbecue. The green beans were inedible, the potato salad good if you like mustard (I do), the cornbread decent but the butter was ice cold rock hard.

Overall just average.

data.title: Nice local place with great food
data.text: I eat here about once a month.  Not because I don't like it but I have trouble not over eating.  The ribs are fall off the bone and the Cornbread excellent.  I don't know what they call it on the menu but a client recommended "That Meat Salad Thing".  Huge amount of various BBQ meats on top of a large salad.  I would not advise this for just one person though

data.title: Scrumptious
data.text:
I love everything , especially the chili.
I used to eat here once per week with co-workers
But stopped, it became a little to pricey and the portions were diminishing.
I'll go back, but it's going to be a special treat.

data.title: Great BBQ
data.text: Gracie's has excellent service and great BBQ.  They are very much a part of the Vallejo scene by supporting Fireworks and other charity evens.  Love the ribs,  The Baby Blu salad is excellent.  If you are traveling through Vallejo or live here, try Gracie's.  You will not be disappointed.

data.title: Home Town Barbecue and Sweets
data.text: Falling off the bone ribs, yummy cornbread, and pies to make your eyes light up, Gracie's delivers it all. Especially fond of the ribs and blackberry pie. Great and friendly service inside or to go.

data.title: Service was great but food is ok
data.text:
Been here 3 times hoping to get that 5 star quality food. Still after 3 visits, nothing. Each time I have ate here the meat has been overcooked and dry. The sides seemed to be leftovers and just reheated and served again. 
I mean its not terrible food, but I have given this place 3 chances to impress me, it hasn't so I'm done here.

data.title: Yummy!
data.text: Gracie's has some of the best BBQ I've ever tasted.  The portions are generous, the staff friendly, and the food the yummiest!  Don't forget to try the cornbread and the pies!!

data.title: adorable and friendly
data.text: I love this place, especially when the whether is nice and I can sit on the patio, which is covered. they serve their lemonade and ice tea in those cool glass jars, and their barbecue is fabulous. I've tried everything here, and my favorite is the chicken.  Lately, I've been trying to eat less meat, and I still go here and just fill up with salad or side dishes. LOVE the cornbread, green beans and the red beans and rice.  Plus, the owner is super nice, and everyone is very friendly. Also, I'm always in a hurry and am impatient, and it's nice to go have a nice sit down casual place where you don't have to wait for an hour

data.title: Um....Amazing!
data.text: Seriously, this restaurant is amazing... served family style we enjoyed hot links, chicken, spare-ribs, potato salad, corn bread, coleslaw, and beans and rice- for dessert - caramel topped apple pie and cherry pie... and we took some croissants home as well. Everything was delicious - and the Arnold Palmer to wash it all down was quite refreshing. Seriously... if you are in Vallejo, you NEED to go to Gracie's BBQ!

data.title: Classic BBQ
data.text: Four of us stopped in for lunch recently. Staff was friendly and helpful without hovering. Big menu to choose from. We ordered ribs, pulled pork sandwich and  special salad for our entrees. Everyone was happy. The ribs fell off the bone and looked  and tasted fabulous. Pulled pork was tender and messy as it should be. No worries, they provided lots of napkins. Sides were good. Took home Apple and cherry pie. Plan to return next month. Want to try the hot links too. Fun atmosphere . . . Casual. Great choice for good eats.

data.title: Great Food
data.text: The food is good, a little expensive but good. Love the ribs and the sauces are great. I also liked the hot link sandwich.

data.title: If u want good bbq...
data.text: Everything is good here!! My favorite is the hot link sandwich or chicken with hot link and mad and cheese on the side!! The hot link is more like a mild link. They don't have any other ones. The Mac and cheese is delicious too

data.title: Great place for dining on a budget!
data.text: If you love barbeque and are low on cash, then Gracie's is the place for you.  The food is consistently very good .... very flavorful, and the prices are very reasonable.  This is a favorite among the locals.

data.title: Good food, friendly people!
data.text: Although I must admit service can be a little bit slow at times, they have great food.  The bbq sauce is fantastic and their coleslaw is the best I've had (and I'm not a coleslaw fan).  I've eaten there multiple times and have never had a bad meal.

data.title: Great  Bbq
data.text: I remember  going to this guy when he had a food truck. Now he has a sit down restaurant. The food especially  the ribs and greens are my go to favorite. Prices  are decent  and  the portions are worth the price.

data.title: Yummy local family BBQ
data.text:
Comfortable relaxed atmosphere. I love the sweet tea and just about everything I have tried on the menu.
A few of my personal favorites:
Meat Lovers Salad
Chicken Croissant Club
Mini Cobb salad

My husband loves the kitchen sink salad as it is the only vegetarian option.
